text: [Music]
I'm Neela Coffman I'm the executive
director of the DC health benefit
exchange authority we are the Affordable
Care Act online health insurance
marketplace here in the District of
Columbia one of our biggest challenges
is to make sure that we are
self-sustaining that we find ways to cut
costs moving to AWS has been the best
thing that we've done when we walked
away from our initial technology which
was a cots product it was hard-coded it
was very expensive we had millions of
dollars in fees that we had to pay it
was not nimble
it wasn't very responsive to our
customers needs and at that time we also
used the old data centers to support it
just for the data centers alone
I had a bill of about two million
dollars a year
switching to AWS cloud I am saving about
1.7 1.8 million each year just on the
data center alone so one of the things
that we've been able to do very quickly
is deploy our technology we were able to
do that quickly by being able to use
what we have with AWS so the vision for
us from the start has been to identify
ways we can share our costs with other
state-based marketplaces where we can
collaborate on developing new technology
upgrading our technology and just
sharing basic costs for licenses we are
looking to partner with other states
especially estates mature their own
online technology so we're looking to
generate revenue to share costs to
become more inexpensive to operate and
we envision doing that continuing to use
cloud-based technology and
cheating significant cost savings with
with AWS we are always looking to raise
the bar we're always looking to be the
gold standards we love learning from
other state based marketplaces but we
are always thinking internally what else
can we do to be at the cutting edge that
will help us serve our customers better
yeah and to be more efficient and
cost-effective
you
[Music]
